alert.note: Alert for Erie; Niagara (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 23 at 2:53PM EST until further notice by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Buffalo NY has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in New York... Black Creek At Churchville affecting Monroe and Genesee Counties. Tonawanda Creek At Batavia affecting Wyoming, Erie, Niagara and Genesee Counties. Tonawanda Creek At Rapids affecting Erie and Niagara Counties. .Rain and snowmelt led to rising levels on creeks and rivers. Flows in rivers will increase quickly and reach critical levels. For the Black Creek...including Churchville...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Tonawanda Creek...including Attica, Batavia, Rapids...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tonawanda Creek At Rapids. * WHEN...From Friday afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Flood stage, lowland flooding of farm areas along Tonawanda Creek between Rapids and the Tonawanda Indian Reservation. Flooding may impact Fletcher, Burdick, Kirby, and Tonawanda Creek Roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 11.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Friday afternoon and continue rising to a crest of 11.7 feet Friday evening. It will then rise to 12.6 feet early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.9 feet on 01/08/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 300 AM EST.
